data.title: Parent's Weekend visit
data.text: Great, great burgers!!!! They were out of several menu items. The hostess was reluctant to find seating for 6 and we had to talk her into seating us at the empty tables at the bar, that was a little weird.  The pulled pork is also delicious.

data.title: Great food but don't be in a hurry!
data.text: We ate here on a football weekend so there were more people than normal I'm sure.  We had reservations for 730 and were seated promptly at 730.  Our server was there in a matter of minutes and beers came out fairly quickly.  Our food on the other hand, took FOREVER!  We did not receive our food until after 9pm.  Everyone in the restaurant was complaining.  Some tables left.  Our waitress was great and kept us informed of the progress but it was unacceptable. However, I am glad that we stayed because the food was delicious.  I had the shrimp and grits.  The BEST I have ever had.  Husband had blackend catch of the day that was great too.  We will go back but probably not on a football weekend.

data.title: Shrimp and GREAT GRITS!!!
data.text:
For the longest time, I have been seeking out a restaurant that served shrimp and grits WITHOUT mushrooms.....and I FOUND ONE!!!   The grits were creamy and delicious and the shrimp nice and spicy and on spot!   Oh, but the cornbread was out of this world!!

My friends and I had a very nice time, our waiter was handsome and helpful, so yeah for me!!  I would definitely recommend this restaurant for seafood, quaint atmosphere and good service

Thanks, Blacken Kracken!!!

data.title: Delicious
data.text: We recently had dinner here, and really enjoyed it.  The shrimp appetizer was a little sweet and a little spicy, and very good.  My wife had a chicken pasta that she really enjoyed and I had shrimp and grits, that were great.  For dessert, the beignets were amazing.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.

data.title: Much better places close by.
data.text:
Went on a Tuesday night; it was not crowded.  They have Po Boys listed on the chalkboard menu, but not the one handed to you.  They can no longer cook them because one oven is out (and they will not invest to get it fixed). They try to be fancy with the square white plates when they need to concentrate on the food.  

Burger was overcooked and dry.  As they were waiting to for the burgers to be done, it seems the fries went cold.  Poor service, as waitress never came by to check on us and/or refill drinks--I constantly had to flag her down.  I had to get up and find her to ask for the check.

If you want good burgers in the Uptown area, go to Pop's (more local, less atmosphere) or Winslow's (much better food, better atmosphere, and more on-tap).

data.title: Excellent value for money
data.text: We had lunch at The Blackened Kraken in May 2016. They had $6 lunch special - wraps and burgers. I had Cajun Jack Burger, my fiance had Buffalo Chicken wrap. Both were amazing! My burger was seasoned real well and came with phenomenal cajun fries. We will definitely be back if we happen to be in Greenville area.

data.title: Perfect Eatery
data.text:
Attracted by the presence of gator on the menu, my wife and I stopped in here for dinner.  This is a wonderful restaurant!  First, the interior is what I would call "charming rustic".  The lighting is low but not too dark, the large windows looking out into the downtown area of Greenville allow a good amount of ambient light, the tables are spaced out nicely so that you can hear those you are with but not those seated next to you, and the tables are a beautiful rustic wood color.  Perhaps the most charming part of the restaurant is the bar which looks like it came right out of the 1920's.

From the moment we walked in, we were greeted by the gentleman behind the bar and the young lady who was our server, Kirsty.  Kirsty was awesome; she truly embodied service with a smile and definitely added to our experience!

The food was great!  The gator was cooked perfectly, which is not always easy to accomplish when cooking alligator.  I had the alligator on a po'boy sandwich and the homemade slaw served along with the alligator was delicious!  My wife had a crab cake sandwich which she also thoroughly enjoyed.

This is definitely a restaurant worth trying if you find yourself wanting something other than barbecue while in Greenville!

data.title: Great creole food
data.text: I had the fried jalapeno corn bread for an app and it was delicious.  My waiter recommended the shrimp and grits and it did not disappoint.  The shrimp was cooked perfectly and the portion size was perfect.  I had the bananas foster beignets and they were greasy and not much banana foster topping on them given the amount of beignets.  Service was attentive but my waiter used too much slang with me like I was one of his college buds.  I would go back for the food and the beer selection.

data.title: Canned vegetables for $15?!
data.text: Took my mom here for her birthday, was our only time going. She ordered the chicken gumbo, which turned out to be canned vegetable soup with pieces of chicken. The cornbread wasn't bad but the service was slow (they weren't busy) and our server was rude. We ordered drinks and he carded my fiance and I, when my mom jokingly asked if he wanted to see hers he said "yea, right."

data.title: About time we get some Cajun spice around here...
data.text: The atmosphere is nice and not too off putting to be downtown near all the watering holes. I got the alligator poboy and my GF got the blackened burger. Food was tasty but I don't know why TripAdvisor has this place at two dollar signs. It is expensive but worth the price if you truly like Cajun cuisine. I only gave it four stars because I am from Louisiana and I can make better food and so can my Pops.

data.title: Not quite mediocre...
data.text: My husband and I are here the other night.  We got the cornbread appitizer,  it was heavily greasy.  My husband ordered the coffee rubbed steak.  I don't think I have ever had such a flavorless piece of meat.  Maybe they forgot the rub?  I had the black and bleu burger.  It was adequate.  Our server was very nice.  Will not be returning.

data.title: A New Eatery For Us
data.text: Recently on a wet rainy Monday Night my wife, son and I drove over from Rocky Mount, NC. We met family who drove to Greenville, NC from Oriental, NC. It was our first visit to the Blackened Kracken. We definitely would return. Our server never missed a beat! Very attentive and answered all questions our party had about offerings on the menu. My raved about her Delmonico steak saying it was one of the best steaks she had ever had. Pretty bold for a lady who grew up in Texas! Another member of our party had the shrimp and grits. They were great! He tries shrimp and grits at restaurants that offers especially if it is a first visit. The Blackened Kracken's shrimp and grits made his top 5! One of the owners who was working stopped by and checked in on our party. This added to our over experience. In closing, great service, good value and fantastic food. Greenville, NC is lucky to have the Blackened Kracken!

data.title: went for early lunch and lots of food "not available yet"
data.text: I will give this place another try since I see there are some good reviews, but I was not impressed. We arrived for lunch on a Wednesday  a bit before noon.  Asked for the soup of day as it was super cold outside, the waitress said the chef had not made it yet as he came in late that day.  I then asked for the gumbo that their large outside sidewalk sign said to try on Wednesdays.  It was Wednesday lunch, but I was again told that they did not have it "yet".   It would be ready in about 20 minutes..   When you are a new restaurant trying to attract local regulars, you can not afford to not have your food ready when you open for the day.  My crab cake sandwich was just ok.  Will try the gumbo when it is available!

data.title: Shrimp and Grits
data.text: We liked it.  The shrimp and grits were great! It is a short walk from campus.  There is a parking deck just around the corner.  Good service, good value, and the food is fantastic.

data.title: Just traveling through - great local find!
data.text: Nice atmosphere and very good food!  I had the shrimp and grits and it was excellent - just the right amount of kick to it.  My friend had the grouper and it was delicious as well.

data.title: Great new place downtown!
data.text: Can't wait to go back and try something else on the menu. Gumbo was awesome and the cornbread was perfect! The alligator po boy (that's right, ALLIGATOR) was delicious and gigantic! Top it all off with some delicious $5 hurricanes and it was like visiting New Orleans in Greenville, NC. I highly recommend everyone tries this place.

data.title: Great for Gluten Free/Special Diet!
data.text: I work just down the street and have eaten here several times. I'm always impressed with the attentiveness of the staff (Travis and the hostess are both terrific). More importantly, the chef always comes out and checks to make sure things are just right. I've never had to wait for a table and have always found prices very reasonable. In Greenville, you cannot find a place better than this for attentive service and quality food- hands down. Better yet, the chef is more than willing (and even excited) to accommodate special requests such as gluten free, dairy free, etc. My wife, who cannot eat either, was absolutely in heaven! She said it's the best she's had since we moved last year. They even have gluten free breading for fried menu items. Give it a try. You won't be disappointed!

data.title: Great food and vibe
data.text: I just made my first visit to this restaurant, and it surely will not be my last. From the moment I walked in I was made to feel at home by the staff.  Bud steered me in the right direction when he suggested I get the shrimp and grits. It was simply amazing. His brother Josh is the chef and brought creativity and pure goodness to this dish. Best I have ever had in fact. The beignets smothered in bananas Foster was a dessert worthy of breaking my new year's resolution so early in the year. All in all this is an excellent restaurant with top-notch and very friendly service.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: I had dinner for the first time tonight at Blackened Kraken. The food was absolutely delicious!! The service was great, nice atmosphere and food was the best I had in a long time. The owner even came over and asked us. How did we enjoy our meal. Needless to say we will be going back.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: Everything was wonderful.  Chef came out of kitchen and offered a few samplers which we promptly ordered. Best shrimp and grits ever!!!!!
